title: New Nexus 5 may have only 2GB of RAM | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Nexus](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**LG’s forthcoming second-generation[Nexus
5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-nexus-5-2015-release-date-rumours-
news-specs-and-price) may have ******only** 2GB of RAM, it’s been claimed.**

We’ve seen [numerous leaks](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-
nexus-5-and-huawei-nexus-6-specs-tipped-in-new-leak) concerning the new Nexus
5, chiefly surrounding its design. Now a fresh snippet regarding the phone’s
specs is causing a little concern among Android fans.

An allegedly leaked slide from a Korean company has been uncovered by Italian
website [Androidworld.it](http://www.androidworld.it/2015/09/09/lg-
nexus-5-2015-slide-333939/) (via [SlashGear](http://www.slashgear.com/lg-
nexus-5-2015-now-leaked-in-black-but-with-only-2gb-ram-09403935/)), and it
appears to confirm the new Nexus 5’s specs – but with one fairly big
alteration.

Most notable among these specs is the idea that the new phone will have only
2GB of RAM. That’s the exact same amount of memory as the old [Nexus
5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/google-nexus-5-review), which launched in
2013.

Most modern flagship smartphones now come with 3GB of RAM, with some even
starting to stretch to 4GB. Does this mean that the new Nexus 5 will be a mid-
ranger?

It’s quite possible that this slide is based off old data, or that it’s simply
mistaken in its 2GB prediction.

2015](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-android-phones-1_round-up)**

Other than this questionable assertion, the leaked slide appears to back what
we’ve heard previously about the new Nexus 5. Apparently, it will have a 5.2in
Full HD display, a Snapdragon 808 CPU, and a choice of either 32GB or 64GB of
internal storage.

Google is also expected to be launching a 5.7in high-end phablet follow-up to
the Nexus 6 over the coming weeks. Unlike the new Nexus 5, it will be made by
Chinese manufacturer Huawei.
